title: MVP: The Minimum Viable Product Philosophy
description: A 60-second lesson on MVP: The Minimum Viable Product Philosophy.

hook.text: Dropbox's MVP was a 3-minute video showing a product that didn't exist yet. 75,000 people signed up overnight.

buildup.text: Eric Ries defined MVP as the simplest version of a product that can test whether customers actually want it â€” before.

discovery.text: The purpose isn't to launch something incomplete. It's to maximize learning with minimum effort â€” validated learning.

twist.text: Zappos' MVP was simpler: the founder photographed shoes at local stores and listed them online.

climax.text: Companies that validate with MVPs are 3x more likely to succeed than those that build full products before testing.

punchline.text: Build the smallest thing that answers the biggest question.

quiz.question: What was Dropbox's MVP?
options: A 3-minute demo video of a product that didn't exist
